title: Mastery/Rune Page Limit
body:
Not sure if this goes here, but I can't think of anywhere else, so yeah... whatever.

So about the whole Mastery and Rune Page limit.
Why is it there?
Does it have to do with League servers, or do they just not want it being abused(like, having a mastery page for every character)?

Anyway, if there's no real reason, I don't see why its there. I mean, I don't know about anyone else, but I could sure use more Mastery pages. Bunch of characters that use pretty unique aspects.

Like, Yasuo and Gangplank. Pretty much the only two characters that use abilities with their basic attacks, have AD, and use critical strikes a lot.
So, what other champs use Spell Weaving, Blade Weaving, Frenzy, and specifically use the AD tree? I can't think of any. Maybe Corki and Kog'Maw for Spell and Blade Weaving, and AD, but not the Frenzy.

Now, another example.
Rumble.
What other champs are like him? There's probably one or two, but I myself can't actually think of any or find any. He uses AP, he's melee and has his passive so he uses Spell and Blade weaving, as well as Arcane Blade(But a lot of AP champs use that).
Like, maybe you could compare him to Teemo or Kayle, but they still have a lot of differences.

Either way, there are a lot of different types of champs, a lot of champion-specific aspects, and if we're being honest here, masteries and runes could literally save your life by the small amounts of damage, attack speed, cooldown reduction, and so on that they give you.

pls rito
at least RAISE the mastery limit ;-;

Especially the mastery page limit could be well served by being a lot higher. They keep releasing new champions and as far as I can gather the limit hasn't changed in years.

Masteries are more important here then runes IMO, for several reasons.

Firstly, masteries are a lot specific than runes, because masteries mostly sync up with champion kits (especially the offensive tree) whereas Runes really sync up more with items (since they cover simpler stats whereas masteries are more lined up with stuff like autoattacking a lot, or mana regen and such).

Masteries are free, runes aren't. Runes cost IP, meaning they take longer time to branch out, meaning that for new players the need for mastery pages expand with each champion you pick up, whereas the need for more rune pages scale much more slowly.

There's also the point of being able to make more mastery pages for other game modes. I'm much less likely to need certain masteries in ARAM or Dominion (specifically the ones which helps your single target minion damage and rewards your CS) simply because in those modes they're not very useful.

But yeah, both masteries and runes need a higher cap for max # of pages. Especially masteries, seeing as even two relatively similar Champions might require different mastery pages (like one with spell/blade weaving and cdr and arcane blade vs an identical page with spell/blade weaving and attack speed but with expose weakness or double edged sword instead of arcane blade).

The restrictive max number of pages probably works fine on a high level of play, especially pro play where you specialize into only one role, since the further up you go the more important and higher the benefit of specialization into a relatively small champion pool. When you only have to worry about picking from a pool of your 25-30 most played champions then pegging down mastery pages that fit your needs for all of them ought to be doable.

When you're sampling periodically from the entire 120+ roster, things get a little bit more tricky.

Making pages that fit 3-5 champions well isn't a real problem.

Making pages that fit 5-8 is often quite a bit more tricky.

---

P.S.

Another reason why more mastery pages are needed as Riot releases new champions, is that newer champions have more complex kits, so they're less likely to synergize well with the same page as other champions. As kits get more diverse and unique, more and more cases of "yeah this page also fits this Champion, except I want those points in CDR instead of spell/blade weaving and that point in more AP instead of arcane blade."
